title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Situation in and in Relation to Burma
summary: The President has continued the national emergency concerning the situation in and in relation to Burma for one year, beyond February 10, 2026. This emergency was initially declared on February 10, 2021, due to an unusual and extraordinary threat to the national security and foreign policy of the United States. The administration continues to monitor developments and engage with partners to encourage dialogue, reduce violence, and increase political stability in Burma, while being prepared to adjust pressure to protect U.S. interests.
